text.text: What steps are involved in reversing a patient payment in ZOLL Billing?

text: To reverse a patient payment in ZOLL Billing, you must first reverse the refund on the Claim page and then reverse the transaction. You can reverse a transaction because of insufficient funds, stopped payment, if it was posted in error. The entire transaction will reverse, this includes every single line item in the transaction.

text.text: Can you explain why someone might need to reverse a patient payment?

text: You can reverse a patient payment for a few reasons, including: Insufficient funds, stopped payment, or if it was posted in error.

text.text: What happens to the claim's status when a payment is reversed?

text: When you reverse a payment, the claim's status changes to "Follow-up - Payment reversal". The claim balance goes up, and the reversal will show in the credit block. The payment will be reversed in the accounting period. If the accounting period in which the transaction was posted is still open, the transaction will reverse in that period. If not, the adjustment will happen in the next open period.

text.text: How does reversing a payment affect the claim balance?

text: When you reverse a payment, the claim balance goes up.

text.text: Where can you find the option to reverse a payment in ZOLL Billing?

text: To reverse a payment, you can go to the Claim page and click on the "Reverse" button.
